Package org.example.mini.model.card

Class Card

java.lang.Object
org.example.mini.model.card.Card
public class Card extends Object
Represents a single playing card used in the game.

A Card has a suit and a rank, can be face up or face down, and knows how much it contributes to the table sum depending on the current game state and the type of player (human or CPU) who plays it.

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(String suit, String rank)
      Creates a new card with the given suit and rank.

      The rank is trimmed and the card is initially face down.

      Parameters:
      suit - the suit of the card (e.g. "hearts", "spades")
      rank - the rank of the card (e.g. "A", "10", "K")

  • Method Details

    • getSuit

      public String getSuit()
      Returns the suit of this card.
      Returns:
      the suit as a String

    • getRank

      public String getRank()
      Returns the rank of this card.
      Returns:
      the rank as a String

    • getValue

      public int getValue()
      Returns the basic numeric value of the card, ignoring game context.

      This is equivalent to getGameValue(int, boolean) with a current sum of 0 and assuming a human player.

      Returns:
      the base value of the card

    • isFaceUp

      public boolean isFaceUp()
      Checks if the card is currently face up.
      Returns:
      true if the card is face up, false otherwise

    • setFaceUp

      public void setFaceUp(boolean faceUp)
      Sets whether the card is face up or face down.
      Parameters:
      faceUp - true to set the card face up, false for face down

    • getGameValue

      public int getGameValue(int currentSum, boolean isForHuman)
      Computes the card's value within the context of the current game state.

      The value can depend on:

      • The rank (e.g. numeric card, face card, Ace).
      • The current sum of the table.
      • Whether the value is being evaluated for a human or CPU player.
      Parameters:
      currentSum - the current sum of all cards on the table
      isForHuman - true if the value is computed for a human player, false for a CPU player
      Returns:
      the numeric value of this card in the given context

    • canBePlayed

      public boolean canBePlayed(int currentSum, boolean isForHuman)
      Checks whether this card can be legally played given the current table sum.

      A card is playable if adding its contextual value to the current sum does not exceed 50.

      Parameters:
      currentSum - the current sum of all cards on the table
      isForHuman - true if the check is for a human player, false for a CPU player
      Returns:
      true if playing this card would keep the total â‰¤ 50, false otherwise

    • getImagePath

      public String getImagePath()
      Returns the relative path to the image resource representing this card.

      The path is constructed from the rank and suit in lowercase, following the pattern: /org/example/mini/view/images/_/&lt;rank&gt;_&lt;suit&gt;.png

      Returns:
      the image path for this card

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a human-readable string representation of this card.

      The format is: "&lt;rank&gt; of &lt;suit&gt; (UP|DOWN)".

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing this card
